p: The MeV is monotypic, but the genetic variability of the genes encoding the viral hemagglutinin (H) and the nucleoprotein (N) makes it possible to be genetically characterized in 8 clades (A-H) and 24 genotypes (A, B1-B3, C1- C2, D1-D11, E, F, G1-G3, H1-H2) [ 8]. Genotype B3 endemic in several African countries can be further divided into 3 clusters (B3.1, B3.2, and B3.3) [ 9].
